---
title: "default.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines default configuration settings for a cache system. It specifies whether the cache is enabled and sets a default time-to-live (TTL) value for cached items.

## Symbols

### `cache`
#### Description
The `cache` key represents the root configuration object for the cache system.

#### Internal Logic
The `cache` object contains two key-value pairs that define the basic settings for the cache:

1. `enabled`: A boolean value that determines whether the cache system is active.
2. `ttl`: A duration value that sets the default time-to-live for cached items.

### `enabled`
#### Description
A boolean flag that indicates whether the cache system is enabled or disabled.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | When set to `true`, the cache system is active. When `false`, the cache is disabled. |

### `ttl`
#### Description
Specifies the default time-to-live (TTL) for items stored in the cache.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| ttl | duration | The length of time that items should remain valid in the cache before expiring. In this case, it's set to 30 minutes. |

## Configuration
This YAML file defines the following configuration options for the cache system:

| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| cache.enabled | boolean | true | Determines whether the cache system is active |
| cache.ttl | duration | 30m | Sets the default time-to-live for cached items to 30 minutes |

Note: The `30m` value for `ttl` represents 30 minutes in duration format commonly used in configuration files.
